summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between FBI Special Agent Angela Jackson and attorneys Gloria Allred and Mariann Wang, discussing logistical arrangements for a DOJ briefing for Epstein victims. The emails focus on gathering victim locations and proposing remote attendance options due to COVID-19 concerns.

persons.name: Angela Jackson
persons.context: FBI Special Agent based in New York coordinating with victim attorneys to organize a DOJ briefing for Epstein victims, requesting information on victim locations.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney representing multiple Epstein victims, communicating with the FBI about victim attendance at a DOJ briefing and advocating for remote participation options.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: Co-counsel to Gloria Allred, providing a list of locations where their Epstein victim clients are located.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: FBI Special Agent based in New York, copied on the email chain regarding the DOJ briefing for Epstein victims.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Executive Assistant to Gloria Allred, acting as an intermediary for communication regarding the DOJ briefing invitations.

events.title: DOJ Briefing Coordination
events.description: FBI and DOJ are organizing a briefing for Epstein victims, with discussions about victim locations and remote attendance options due to COVID-19.

keyFacts: The FBI and DOJ were organizing a briefing for Epstein victims in late October 2020, with invitations sent to victims represented by Gloria Allred.
Attorneys for the victims expressed that requiring in-person attendance in Miami during the COVID-19 pandemic was unreasonable and advocated for secure remote options like Zoom.
Victim clients of Gloria Allred were located in diverse international and U.S. locations including New Jersey, Oslo, London, Pasadena, other California locations, NYC, and Moscow.
The email chain reveals ongoing coordination between law enforcement (FBI/DOJ) and victim attorneys regarding victim outreach and communication in the Epstein case.
